intro: Agathotes nervosa, commonly known as the veined agathos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have prominent veins, contributing to its common name. Agathotes nervosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
